alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Langlade; Manitowoc; Marathon; Menominee; Northern Marinette County; Northern Oconto County; Outagamie; Portage; Shawano; Southern Marinette County; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 3:09PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...WET SNOW ACROSS EAST-CENTRAL WISCONSIN THIS AFTERNOON INTO SATURDAY MORNING... Periods of snow will continue this afternoon into Saturday morning. Above freezing temperatures near the surface will also result in rain at times, especially near the shores of Lake Michigan south of Kewaunee. Uncertainty regarding how much snow will melt when hitting the initially warm ground is adding an extra layer of uncertainty to the snowfall forecast. The best estimate is that a band of 2 to 4 inches of wet snow accumulation will occur from the Wautoma/Oshkosh areas, through the Green Bay area, to the Door Peninsula. A narrow band of higher snow totals is possible. Minor adjustments maybe still be needed as it becomes clear if a locally higher band will set up. The impact the snow has on travel is also somewhat uncertain. Warm ground temperatures have prevented much snow from accumulating on pavement. But some roads will likely start becoming slushy during the late afternoon and evening hours, with hazardous travel conditions possible tonight into Saturday morning. Anyone traveling this afternoon into tonight should check the latest road conditions prior to departing. The latest road conditions for Wisconsin can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
